description: Staff at the Federal Reserve cooperated with the Treasury Department to give Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency access to federal payment systems, according to a new court filing.
title: Fed Staff Met With Treasury’s DOGE Team in January, Filing Shows

description: The Houthi militant group in Yemen announced it would immediately resume attacks on Israeli ships for the first time in about two months over Israel’s decision to bar aid from entering Gaza.
title: Houthis Vow to Resume Attacks on Israeli Ships Over Aid to Gaza

description: Less than two weeks after Donald Trump lambasted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in an Oval Office confrontation, the US president put the pressure on Russia to accept a ceasefire agreement hammered out with Zelenskiy’s advisers.
title: Ukraine-US Accord on a Ceasefire Proposal Puts the Onus on Putin

description: The US Senate confirmed Gail Slater to lead antitrust enforcement at the Justice Department, installing a key official who will oversee lawsuits alleging illegal monopolization by companies including Alphabet Inc.’s Google, Apple Inc. and Visa Inc.
title: Trump’s DOJ Antitrust Chief Gail Slater Wins Senate Confirmation

description: The UK government is abolishing the Payment Systems Regulator as part of its attempts to cut “unnecessary regulation” and stoke economic growth.
title: UK Axes Payment Systems Regulator in Attempt to Cut Red Tape

description: President Donald Trump said that protesters who are vandalizing Tesla’s showrooms and charging stations should be considered domestic terrorists.
title: Trump Says That Attacks on Tesla Stores Are Domestic Terrorism

description: The Education Department is pushing to terminate half of its more than 4,000 employees, the Trump administration’s first major step in dismantling an agency it has targeted to shutter completely.
title: Education Department Plans to Cut Half of Workforce in DOGE Push

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove looks at the reaction to the president’s latest tariff volley. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Relents, a Little, on Trade Feud, but Metal Tariffs Still On

description: Australia won’t be granted an exemption from steel and aluminum tariffs despite a lobbying campaign by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s government, in a blow to relations between the two longtime allies.
title: Trump Rules Out Steel, Aluminum Tariff Exemption for Australia

description: President Donald Trump downplayed a sharp market selloff spurred by worries that his tariff agenda will drag the world’s largest economy into a downturn, saying he did not foresee the US going into a recession.
title: Trump Says He Doesn’t See US Recession, Downplays Market Turmoil

description: Democratic Republic of Congo and M23 rebels will engage in direct negotiations in the coming days to end the conflict in the country’s mineral-rich east, according to the presidency of Angola, which will mediate the talks.
title: Congo to Negotiate With Rwanda-Backed M23 Rebels, Angola Says

description: Tit-for-tat tariffs between Canada and the US will create pain on both sides, Canada’s Energy Minister said, urging the US to have a constructive dialogue on trade.
title: Canada Energy Minister Warns of Pain on Both Sides in Trade Spat

description: Portugal’s parliament toppled Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s center-right minority government in a confidence vote Tuesday, likely leading the country to its third early election in just over three years.
title: Portugal’s Government Collapses After Losing Parliamentary Vote

description: Dave Weldon, President Donald Trump’s pick to run the country’s top public health agency, said in a recent meeting that he still believes the debunked theory that the childhood immunization schedule may be linked to autism, according to a Democratic senator in attendance.
title: Trump’s CDC Pick Is Pushing Vaccine-Autism ‘Lie,’ Senator Says

description: Staff at USAID were ordered to destroy classified documents and personnel records, according to a memo from a top official, prompting a fresh legal challenge as well as alarm from the union that represents foreign service officers.
title: USAID Official Orders Staff to Destroy Classified Documents

description: Dave Portnoy, the controversial owner of Barstool Sports, said he was asked by the Trump administration to join the US Commerce Department.
title: Dave Portnoy Says He Was Offered a Job at Commerce Department

description: Canada will keep its trade retaliation in place until the US lifts its own tariffs and commits to free trade, said Mark Carney, who will succeed Justin Trudeau as Canada’s prime minister within days.
title: Canada’s Carney Will Keep Tariffs Until US Commits to Free Trade

description: Puma SE forecast another slow year of growth in 2025 due to global trade tariffs, currency volatility and geopolitical tensions.
title: Puma Warns Tariffs, Geopolitical Tensions in 2025 Forecast

description: Ukraine said it’s ready to accept a US proposal for a 30-day truce in Russia’s war, according to a statement on the Ukrainian president’s website following the talks in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday.
title: Ukraine Ready to Accept US Proposal for 30-Day Truce

description: The Bank of Canada is likely to cut interest rates for a seventh straight meeting on Wednesday as the country braces for a trade war that will plunge the economy into recession unless there’s a swift resolution.
title: Bank of Canada to Cut as Tariffs Strike Economy: Decision Guide

description: Of all the European Union countries targeted for criticism by the Trump administration, none has attracted more vitriol than Romania.
title: Why JD Vance, Elon Musk Are Weighing in on Romania's Politics

description: Europe’s counterpart to NASA is seeking new partnerships in space with a range of other countries as the continent bolsters its defenses and faces a more isolationist US under President Donald Trump.
title: Europe Seeks New Space Partnerships in Turbulent Trump Era

description: The Trump administration has dismantled the United States Agency for International Development, eliminating the vast majority of the agency’s programs while preparing to fold the remainder into the State Department. The sweeping cuts will slash tens of billions of dollars in assistance that the US provides to developing nations, from efforts to combat malaria in Africa to farming assistance in Ukraine.
title: How Trump’s Dismantling of USAID Will Affect Foreign Aid

description: The Russian offensive in eastern Ukraine is stalling just as officials in Moscow prepare to engage with a US push to end their three-year war, according to a Bloomberg analysis of open-source battlefield data.
title: Russia’s Advances in Eastern Ukraine Are Stalling Ahead of Talks

description: Romania’s constitutional court upheld a decision banning presidential front-runner Calin Georgescu from May’s election, ending a bid that plunged the country into the biggest political crisis since the fall of communism.
title: Romanian Court Upholds Far-Right Georgescu’s Election Ban

description: House Republicans will move Tuesday to block Democrats from forcing a painful vote on Donald Trump’s tariffs as the president amps up the US trade war with Canada.
title: House GOP Moves to Block Potential Challenges to Trump Tariffs

description: Ontario’s premier repeated that he’s willing to shut off electricity exports to the US to send a message to the White House after President Donald Trump said he’ll double tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminum to 50%.
title: Ontario Premier Says He’ll Cut Power Exports to US If Necessary

description: The UK government is expecting to get hit by President Donald Trump’s steel and aluminum tariffs, even as the British side holds out hope that positive trade negotiations with the US could result in an 11th-hour reprieve.
title: UK Braces for Trump Steel Tariffs Despite Hopes for Reprieve

description: President Donald Trump’s administration is preparing a new travel rule that could force Canadians planning to stay in the country for more than 30 days to register their information with the US government and submit to fingerprinting.
title: Trump to Require Registration of Some Canadian Visitors

description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan said new UK planning rules proposed Tuesday will help tackle the city’s affordable housing shortage by addressing the “big issue” of land value.
title: London Mayor Khan Says New Planning Rules to Boost Housebuilding

description: After the Federal Aviation Administration’s antiquated air-traffic control systems attracted widespread attention in recent weeks, the agency is now confronted with another aging infrastructure problem that’s closer to home: lead in the water at its Washington headquarters.
title: FAA Employees Return to Office to Discover Lead in Their Water

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro said he’s willing to suspend a confidence vote scheduled for Tuesday as he argued that the disruption of a snap election would be down to the intransigence of the opposition Socialists.
title: Portugal Premier Says He’s Willing to Halt Confidence Vote

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said a plane carrying former President Rodrigo Duterte has left the country for The Hague to allow the ex-leader to face charges of crimes against humanity committed during his deadly drug war.
title: Marcos Says Duterte to Face Charges Over Drug War at The Hague

description: Canola futures extended a drop to the lowest levels since December after President Donald Trump said he’s increasing steel and aluminum tariffs on Canada, the top producer of the oilseed.
title: Canola Hits Three-Month Low on Trump Call for New Canada Tariffs

description: South Sudan is on the verge of fresh civil war with a tenuous power-sharing agreement between President Salva Kiir and First Vice President Riek Machar under pressure from renewed violence.
title: Renewed Unrest Threatens to Erupt Into Civil War in South Sudan

description: The UK government will raise the reporting threshold at which people have to self-declare earnings for income tax, a move it said would help people who earn money from so-called “side hustles” like dog-walking, trading clothes online and gardening.
title: UK to Raise Income Tax Reporting Threshold to Help Side-Hustlers

description: The Canadian dollar slid to a weekly low and local bonds rallied after US President Donald Trump said he would raise steel and aluminum tariffs on Canada to 50%, doubling a planned levy set to take effect on Wednesday.
title: Canada Dollar Slumps as Trump Threatens to Double Steel Levy

description: European Union finance ministers are worried bond investors could be reluctant to finance their defense-spending plans, with a massive German program already driving up debt-servicing costs in the region.
title: EU Finance Chiefs Fret Defense Spending Plans May Push Up Yields

description: Ukraine claimed it hit a major oil refinery that supplies Moscow and its airports, as part of a record drone barrage ahead of talks between Kyiv and the US over a potential ceasefire.
title: Ukraine Says Its Drones Hit Major Oil Refinery in Moscow

description: The US Department of Health and Human Services increased its voluntary buyout offer for some employees for further layoffs this week as the agency faces pressure to reduce headcount, according to an email viewed by Bloomberg.
title: HHS Increases Buyout Offer, With Some Workers Offered Paid Leave

description: Tankers stir after year-long hiatus to load key Pacific grade ESPO
title: Russian Oil Flows Surge in Sign US Sanctions Starting to Crumble

description: Former US Representative Katie Porter has joined a crowded field of Democrats in the 2026 race to succeed California Governor Gavin Newsom.
title: Trump Antagonist Katie Porter Joins Race for California Governor

description: President Donald Trump said he was increasing the steel and aluminum tariff on Canadian goods to 50% to retaliate against Ontario’s move to place a levy on electricity sent to the US.
title: Trump Says He’s Doubling Tariffs On Canadian Steel, Aluminum

description: The US Navy keeps falling short in shipbuilding, with costs too high and deliveries too slow, the service’s acting acquisition chief said in written testimony submitted for a House hearing on Tuesday.
title: US Navy Shipbuilding Called Too Slow and Costly as Trump Vows Change

description: Vice President JD Vance on Tuesday urged all House Republicans to support a stopgap funding package set for a vote later in the day, arguing that its passage was essential to keep President Donald Trump’s agenda on schedule.
title: Vance Urges Wavering House GOP to Approve Stopgap Funding

description: Donald Trump Jr met with Serbia’s President Aleksandar Vucic in Belgrade amid a wave of anti-government protests and political crises brewing in neighboring Balkan nations.
title: Trump Jr. Meets Embattled Leader Vucic in Surprise Serbia Visit

description: If and when President Donald Trump’s tariffs on steel and aluminum take effect at a minute past midnight in Washington on Wednesday, it will mark a repeat of first-term levies that he and his supporters argue helped rescue the US’s metal makers.
title: From Baseball Bats to Caskets, Trump Tariffs Set to Hit Home

description: The trade battle between the US and Canada is prompting economists to predict the Bank of Canada will lower its policy interest rate to 2% this year, almost as low as before the Covid-19 pandemic.
title: Trade War to Force Bank of Canada to Cut Deeper, Economists Say

description: The European Union’s tax chief said that the bloc’s use of value-added taxes shouldn’t be part of the trade tensions with the Trump administration.
title: EU Tax Chief Disputes Trump’s Claim That VAT Is a Trade Barrier

description: Ghana’s new government outlined a lower budget deficit this year to “fix” the economy after a painful debt restructuring.
title: Ghana’s New Government Vows to ‘Fix’ Economy, Curb Inflation

description: In most other years, an election in a sparsely populated Arctic island would fly largely under the radar. But as voters in Greenland head to the polls on March 11, they’ll be doing so under the shadow of US President Donald Trump wanting to take control of the semi-autonomous territory from Denmark — a threat that’s making Greenlanders “feel unsafe,” according to their prime minister, Mute B. Egede.
title: What the Trump Factor Means for Greenland’s Election

description: Portugal’s Socialists, the biggest opposition party, led Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s AD coalition by a margin of 1.5 percentage point in an opinion poll, Jornal de Negocios reported on its website.
title: Portugal’s Opposition Socialists Lead in Poll, Negocios Reports

description: US President Donald Trump’s back-and-forth tariff threats are galvanizing an “invest in Canada” movement that’s prodding pensions to keep more of their cash at home.
title: ‘Buy Canada’ Pressure Builds on $1.6 Trillion in Pension Pot

description: New York City’s regional economy may gain as much as $1.3 billion annually as a new toll to drive along Manhattan’s busiest streets eases traffic gridlock and benefits business activity, according to a civic group focused on economic health.
title: NYC Toll Projected to Boost Economy by as Much as $1.3 Billion

description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte said her father, the former leader Rodrigo Duterte, is “being forcibly taken to The Hague” on Tuesday night.
title: Philippines VP Duterte Says Father Being Taken to The Hague

description: Forecasts indicating a third year of economic contraction may force Austria’s new government to find additional budget consolidation measures, according to its new finance minister.
title: Austria Sees Third Year of Recession Requiring More Budget Cuts

description: Western security officials said Russian President Vladimir Putin has no intention to compromise on demands on land, peacekeepers and Ukraine’s neutrality in any peace talks, complicating President Donald Trump’s efforts to secure a credible settlement.
title: Western Officials Say Putin Knows His Ukraine Terms Won’t Be Met

description: US President Donald Trump has pledged to impose so-called reciprocal tariffs on imports from foes and allies alike from April 2, matching their levies to redress any perceived trade barriers for American companies.
title: Why India Is So Worried About Trump’s Tariff Threats

description: American manufacturers are paying much higher prices for aluminum, steel and copper than rival plants overseas, in a trend that’s sapping business confidence and stoking worries about inflation even before tariffs on metals come into effect.
title: Tariff Turmoil Leaves US Factories Paying More for Metal Than Overseas Rivals

description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has asked the Supreme Court to halt the enforcement of the International Criminal Court’s order to arrest him over his deadly anti-drug campaign.
title: Duterte Asks Court to Stop Enforcement of ICC Arrest Order

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Taiwan’s Silicon Shield Suddenly Doesn’t Look So Strong

description: Portugal’s parliament is set to topple Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s center-right minority government in a confidence vote on Tuesday, likely leading to the country’s third early election in just over three years.
title: Portugal’s Government Is Set to Be Toppled in Confidence Vote

description: Top US and Ukrainian officials began talks in Saudi Arabia about the path to a possible peace deal with Moscow, hours after Russia fought off the largest drone attack on its territory in the three-year war.
title: US and Ukraine Begin Talks on Path to Possible Truce With Russia

description: Hungary’s new central bank leadership under Governor Mihaly Varga has launched a probe into controversial foundations that his predecessor set up more than a decade ago.
title: Hungary’s Central Bank Chief Probes Predecessor’s Foundations

description: The Lockheed Martin Corp.-Boeing Co. joint venture that competes with Elon Musk’s SpaceX to launch the most sensitive US national security satellites had subpar performance meeting its goals last year, according to the Air Force’s latest assessment of its best and worst-performing programs.
title: Lockheed-Boeing Venture That’s SpaceX Rival Ranked Subpar by Air Force

description: As Donald Trump’s tariffs send markets into a tailspin, pressure is mounting on the president to speed up his main proposal for juicing the economy: a sweeping tax bill.
title: Tariff Panic on Wall Street Pressures Trump to Speed Up Tax Cuts

description: Serbian protesters blocked offices of the state broadcaster in the capital and second-largest city Novi Sad overnight, in a bid to draw attention to their months-long rallies against the rule of President Aleksandar Vucic.
title: Serbian Protesters Blockade State Television in Police Standoff

description: Talks between India’s state-owned refiners and traders selling Russian crude suggest ample supply is available to meet near-term demand, easing concerns that flows could slow for months after latest wave of US sanctions.
title: Russian Cargo Offers Cheer India Buyers Fearing Crude Shortfall

description: The European Union mustn’t let up in its efforts to help Ukraine resist Russia, according to Polish Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski.
title: Europe Must Put Further Pressure on Russia, Poland Says

description: The Swedish Security Service warned of a tangible risk that the security status in the Nordic country will deteriorate further.
title: Sweden’s Top Police Unit Warns of Worsening Security Situation

description: Former Credit Suisse Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam has been chosen to lead a broad coalition of Ivory Coast opposition parties ahead of presidential elections in October.
title: Ex-Credit Suisse Boss to Lead Ivory Coast Opposition Coalition

description: Singapore released a report setting out its electoral boundaries, a key move signaling that the city-state’s next vote will be called soon.
title: Singapore Election Nears With Key Boundaries Report Issued

description: Germany’s Greens are ready to negotiate and are hoping for an agreement by the end of this week in a dispute over defense spending with the country’s prospective next ruling coalition led by Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz.
title: German Greens See Chance for Defense Spending Deal This Week

description: Taiwan started anti-dumping probes into beer and certain steel products from China, adding to a string of measures targeting Chinese exports by trade partners around the world.
title: China Beer, Steel Hit With Anti-Dumping Probes by Taiwan

description: The US president says no one has been harder on Russia, but these days no one has been weaker.
title: Putin's Faced Some Tough US Presidents. Not This One.

description: Ghana Finance Minister Cassiel Ato Forson’s budget on Tuesday is expected to deliver spending cuts as the new government seeks economic stability after a painful debt restructuring.
title: Ghana Facing Austerity Budget as New Government Eyes Spending

description: Greenlanders head to the polls on Tuesday in a general election that will determine how and when the semi-autonomous territory may seek independence from Denmark after Donald Trump upended the island’s politics.
title: Greenlanders Vote With Independence Path at Stake: What to Watch

description: For Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, the debt crisis that caused Silvio Berlusconi’s downfall remains such an unnerving memory that it keeps driving her decision-making.
title: Italy’s Bond Angst Shapes Meloni Strategy From Defense to Banks

description: US President Donald Trump said he’ll buy a “brand new” Tesla to support Elon Musk, after shares of the electric car maker had their worst day in four years amid a growing backlash over Musk’s political allegiances.
title: Trump Says He’ll Buy a Tesla to Support Musk After Shares Plunge

description: Talks between the US and China on trade and other issues are stuck at lower levels, people familiar with the matter said, with both sides talking past each other and failing to agree on the best way to proceed.
title: US-China Tariff Talks Stuck at Lower Levels, Stoking Frustration

description: Russian air defenses downed 69 Ukrainian drones targeting Moscow in what seems to be the largest attack aimed at the Russian capital of the three-year-long war.
title: Ukraine Launches Record Drone Wave at Moscow Before US Talks

description: The Philippines said former President Rodrigo Duterte is under police custody after the International Criminal Court issued an arrest warrant following an investigation into his deadly drug war.
title: Ex-Philippine Leader Duterte Arrested in Drug War Case

description: A Chinese aluminum trader involved in a metal inventory scam that caused more than $1 billion in losses has been sentenced to life in prison by a court in the eastern province of Zhejiang.
title: Rogue Aluminum Trader Gets Life in Jail After $1 Billion Fraud

description: For some years now, China’s annual gathering of its national legislature has been an increasingly disciplined and choreographed affair — its muted vibes practically an echo of deepening concern about domestic stagnation.
title: DeepSeek-Fueled AI Fever Injects New Energy Into China’s NPC

description: A federal judge ruled that Elon Musk’s government efficiency project must comply with records demands from a public interest group, rejecting the administration’s position that the office created by President Donald Trump is exempt from a US transparency law.
title: Musk’s DOGE Must Comply With Public Records Requests, Judge Says

description: Australia is playing down the possibility of an exemption from steel and aluminum tariffs expected from US President Donald Trump within days, despite last-minute discussions between officials in Canberra and Washington.
title: Australia Makes Trump Tariff Exemption Push as Deadline Nears

description: Around 300 groups representing the food and agriculture sectors urged the Trump administration to use “sound, quality science” when seeking to improve the health of American citizens.
title: RFK Jr. Pressed by Farm and Food Groups to Use ‘Sound’ Science

description: The ultra-conservative House Freedom Caucus threw its backing behind a stopgap funding package, bolstering Speaker Mike Johnson’s attempt to pass the bill without the help of House Democrats and avert a government shutdown on March 15.
title: House Freedom Caucus Backs Stopgap Bill to Avert US Shutdown

description: Argentine President Javier Milei signed an emergency executive decree on Monday to mandate a new deal with the International Monetary Fund, news outlets La Nacion and Clarin reported, signaling that a staff-level agreement is closer than ever.
title: Argentina’s Milei Signs Executive Decree to Back IMF Program
